thread.title: New York engineer ditched his career to travel the world as a photographer
thread.title_full: New York engineer ditched his career to travel the world as a photographer | Daily Mail Online

author: Caroline Mcguire for MailOnline
title: New York engineer ditched his career to travel the world as a photographer
text:
64 shares 6
View
comments
Have you ever wanted to change jobs but couldn't quite muster up the courage? Well, Porter Yates , 35, from Brooklyn, New York , did just that five years ago and he hasn't looked back.
In 2010, Yates was at a crossroads in his engineering job and wanted a new direction in life, so he decided to go travelling and document what he saw.
He returned to engineering, arranging a job in China in 2012, but discovered that he was more passionate about photographing the country than his job.
Since then, he has focused on photography and has made a career out of his hobby, travelling to places like Ecuador, Indonesia, India, Tibet and Mexico, and selling the images he captures in order to make a living.
He told MailOnline: When I first started traveling I knew little about the places I had never been, my ignorance of a place walled it off and made it feel inaccessible.
'The unknown can be very intimidating. The more I travelled the more I was surprised about how accommodating the world is. It still confounds me.'
Read on to see some of Porter's photos from his travels around the world.
A boy stands with an elephant at an elephant village in Jaipur, India. This is Porter's favourite picture
A man of the Mentawai tribe walks by a river bank near his home on Siberut Island, Indonesia
